background: A drug company utilizes two different processes to produce pain killers and sleeping pills, with each process having its specific production rates for both drugs and using a certain amount of preliminary material.
constraints: Number of hours process 1 is run is non-negative
Number of hours process 2 is run is non-negative
Total material used by both processes is at most TotalMaterial units
At least MinPainKillers units of pain killers must be produced
At least MinSleepingPills units of sleeping pills must be produced
objective: Minimize the total time needed to produce the required units of pain killers and sleeping pills
description: A drug company is making pain killers and sleeping pills using two processes, process 1 and process 2. Process 1 produces \param{PainKillersProcess1} units of pain killers and \param{SleepingPillsProcess1} units of sleeping pills per hour. Process 2 produces \param{PainKillersProcess2} units of pain killers and \param{SleepingPillsProcess2} units of sleeping pills per hour. Process 1 requires \param{MaterialProcess1} units of preliminary material while process 2 requires \param{MaterialProcess2} units of preliminary material. The drug company has available \param{TotalMaterial} units of preliminary material and must make at least \param{MinPainKillers} units of pain killers and \param{MinSleepingPills} units of sleeping pills. How many of each process should be run to minimize the total time needed?

parameters.definition: Units of pain killers produced per hour by process 1
Units of sleeping pills produced per hour by process 1
Units of pain killers produced per hour by process 2
Units of sleeping pills produced per hour by process 2
Units of preliminary material required for process 1
Units of preliminary material required for process 2
Total units of preliminary material available
Minimum units of pain killers to be produced
Minimum units of sleeping pills to be produced
